First, the pipeline would cross right under the Missouri River at Lake Oahe, half a mile north of the reservation. A leak or spill could send oil directly into the tribeâ€s main source of drinking water. The tribe points out that Dakota Access originally considered a route farther north, upstream of Bismarck, but the company rejected that route, in part, because of the close proximity to the state capitalâ€s drinking-water wells. Second, the tribe argues that the pipeline would run through a stretch of land north of the reservation that contains recently discovered sacred sites and burial places. True, this land isnâ€t part of the current reservation. But the Standing Rock Sioux argue that the land had been taken away from them unjustly over the past 150 years. And any bulldozing and construction work could damage these sites.

Physical movement is so crucial to child development. We see their smiles when they can move. I believe the enjoyment children derive from movement and challenging their physical abilities comes from their being wired up to develop. They work constantly to learn and develop! :-) This is more than physical development, although that is important, it also develops important neural pathways. The current fad of pushing """"academic"""" learning on younger and younger children is badly misguided. Finland doesn't do what the US does but then we wouldn't want to be recognized as the best education system on the planet. Our children might be smarter if we copied Finland. (Sadly, that last part is sarcasm.) Non sarcastic note: many, many teachers love children, love teaching and do a good job!

Not naive, speaking from experience. Boxing is therapeutic for aggression. I am commenting from experience in a program which was piloted in one of the neighbourhoods of the region I live in, and none of the 1250 participants over 12 years has been involved in any violence.

The status quo is not working for our trade/economy. Trade deficit doesn't make us stronger. Manufacturing is regulated to such levels to push them out of the country and leave. Those that are still here import H-1b visa'd workers from 3rd world countries. We are getting screwed on both sides of it.
